alert.note: Alert for Central Sacramento Valley; Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 12:40PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Glenn County through 145 PM PDT... At 1239 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Chrome to near Stoney Gorge Reservoir. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and and accumulating small hail with half inch hail possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail covered roads possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elk Creek, Chrome, Fruto and Stoney Gorge Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Sacramento Valley; Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County
